title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Plant and System Operators

content.rendered:
What is a Plant and System Operator?

Plant and System Operators control and operate chemical processes or systems of machines. 

Where does a Plant and System Operator work?

  • Chemical plants
  • Water treatment sites

How much does a Plant and System Operator make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Plant and System Operator is $57,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Plant and System Operator?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Mechanical engineering majors
  • Chemistry majors
  • Biology majors
Search Plant and System Operator jobs on Handshake

Plant and System Operator skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Plant and System Operators succeed in their work:

  • Attention to detail
  • Teamwork
  • Problem solving

What are some common questions about Plant and System Operators?

Q: What do Plant and System Operators do?

A: Some tasks for this role might include: monitoring recording instruments, operating or shutting down equipment, or controlling the chemical processes.
